name: The Old Manse Guest House

reviews.text: We arrived here after two nights in a poor hotel elsewhere in Scotland so it was wonderful to find such clean and spacious rooms with every facility. We were warmly welcomed by Anna and Simon, and a glass of sherry!, and the breakfasts lived up to previous reviews. We ate the first evening in the Steak House (Rowantree hotel) which was good and the second in the Oban Fish and Chip Shop –just the job if you want a quick, tasty and well served meal. Most of the restaurants are only a 5/10 minute walk away but there is quite a hill to climb on the way back. Another place we found for a light lunch or afternoon tea was Poppies Garden Centre just a couple of miles north of the town centre – right on the water with lovely views and the most gorgeous cakes.
reviews.title: Great hospitality and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stopped here for five nights and really enjoyed ourselves its in a good location with easy access via the garden gate down to the town centre.its comfortable and the breakfasts are good especially the porridge with fruit and maple syrup,lots of good advice and leaflets available .we have stopped in oban many times over the last twenty years and i have to say this was one of the best b&b's that we have stayed in inspite of the husband being a leeds united supporter.
reviews.title: a bracing winter break
A gem
reviews.text: There cant be too many B and B' s where you share a glass of wine with the owners whilst paying your bill and discussing your stay. Quite simply its a joy to stay here.Great breakfasts,I'd recommend the haddock and eggs.Simon is a great host and Anna a great cook.Loved the Tartan carpets in the hallway and stairs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is only one downside,I found it very difficult to leave my seat in a room overlooking the Oban bay and the islands of Kerrera,Lismore and Mull, what a vista.
reviews.title: The Old Manse Guest House is a credit to owners Simon and Anna.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks guys for making it a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Friendly place with a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed every aspect of our stay at The old Manse. Simon and Anna made us very welcome, and provided lots of useful local info. Our room was spacious and well kitted out with a fine view across to Kerrera and Mull. The breakfasts were excellent with plenty of choice and much use of local ingredients such as the delicious Seil island eggs, and on the morning we had to leave very early for our cruise to Barra (highly recommended!) a very good continental breakfast was provided in our room.
reviews.title: The best guest house in Oban?

reviews.text: Thanks again, Simon and Anna; we'll be back!
reviews.title: Beautiful holiday in a beautiful location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our second visit and just as good as the first.
reviews.title: Great guesthouse, excellent hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anna and Simon are perfect hosts and work very hard to make your stay comfortable and relaxed.
reviews.title: Beautiful Guest House, great host, stunning sea view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are large and clean with a great facilities. Even a Sherry is provided.
reviews.title: Great Welcome, Ideal location, Well Looked After

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stumbled across the Old Manse Guesthouse while searching online, and it turned out to be a great find! The owners were young and friendly, the en-suite room was well-sized and comfortable, it was just a short walk down the hill into the center of Oban, and the breakfast was delicious!!! (If you need a break from the heavy "full Scottish breakfast," I highly recommend the oatmeal!) They had free wi-fi (which can be tricky because of the thick walls of the old building-don't be afraid to ask for help! You'll have the best luck in the dining room) and menus from lots of nearby restaurants to help you choose a place for dinner. It wasn't the least expensive option in Oban, but I don't think we would have enjoyed staying anywhere else quite as much.
reviews.title: Friendly young owners, perfect location, awesome breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent 3 very enjoyable nights at The Old Manse, we were made very welcome by Simon and Ann. We could not fault the lovely room and en suite, the breakfast choice and quality was excellent. Nice quiet location, only a 5 minute walk from Oban centre, Simon has taken the trouble to collate lots of suggested trips for both wet and dry days. You really felt like you were a welcome guest in their home and I would have no hesitation in recommending this guest house.
reviews.title: Very welcoming, clean and ideal location with great breakfast !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely room with excellent view. Superb breakfasts. Owners could not have been any more welcoming or helpful. Would highly recommend The Old Manse Guest House.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Simon was very pleasant and helpful when planning our excursions an dining out. Breakfasts were excellent. Our room was very comfortable and clean. Wonderful views. Would definitely stay at the Old Manse Guest House again.
reviews.title: Quaint, Friendly B & B

reviews.text: Stayed for four nights in June, rooms great, service top class, hosts very friendly and welcoming, lovely breakfasts, great location and good value. Couldn't have asked for more, will return when venture back to West coast.
reviews.title: excellent guest house, fantastic location

reviews.text: Simon and Anna are welcoming, friendly hosts who made our stay in their home very relaxing, comfortable and fun. We enjoyed stunning views over Oban Bay from our bedroom on the first floor and also from the dining room below. The Old Manse is situated just a few minutes walk from town and is close to many other points of interest which can be reached by walking, driving, bus, train or boat. There is heaps to do in and around Oban, and we were just surrounded by beauty everywhere we looked. Thoroughly recommended in every way.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay with very friendly, helpful hosts.

reviews.text: My wife and I toured Scotland with another couple in May. We stayed at B&B's throughout Scotland and all agreed that we enjoyed The Old Manse the best. We were able to stay in the front rooms which had the best views of the bay. We were fortunate to see better sunsets here in Oban than any we saw when we went to Hawaii!
reviews.title: A great view in a house with character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was comfortable and the rooms were nicely appointed. Yes, it is an old house but that is what gives it character. The breakfasts were very nicely done with choices of the full Scottish breakfast or other offerings each day including pancakes and fruit. Simon was very helpful giving us tips on places to eat in town. It is an easy five minute walk into town and Oban is a great base for touring the western part of Scotland as well as the islands. Our trip to Mull and Iona was a highlight of our vacation.
reviews.title: Outstanding B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I also enjoyed the hiking/walking trails of Oban that were furnished to us by the Old Manse. It gave me a chance to do some exercise and see some outstanding scenery around town.
reviews.title: Great Holiday we were well looked after

reviews.text: Overall, I have only good things to say about the Old Manse Guest House.
reviews.title: Fantastic: friendly, comfortable, delicious food!

aka: The Old Manse Guest House Hotel Oban
description: Fine victorian villa in its own beautiful grounds which has been lovingly restored to provide first class bed and breakfast accomodation. Stunning sea views, peaceful gardens and only 2 minutes from town.Off road parking for all. Free Wi-fi. Freshly cooked breakfast from a varied menu from porridge and pancakes to fish and full Scottish; we are happy to cater for all diets. Nothing is too much trouble to help you enjoy a relaxing break.
